decision_conditions: Retain car parking for res occupiers
description: Amendments to planning permission dated 08 August 2017 (RN: 16/12291/FULL) for variation of condition 1 of planning permission dated 2 April 2015 (RN: 14/08070/FULL) for Demolition of existing Barracks buildings(except for the listed Riding School) and redevelopment for residential use(Class C3) providing 163 units incl 59 affordable units; use of listed Riding School as private ancillary leisure facility w/ internal and external alterations. Provision of Class A1/A3 retail units and Class D1 at ground level at 1-7 Queen's Terrace, redevelopment behind retained front facade and erection of a mansard roof extension, creation of landscaped areas and reconfigured vehicular and pedestrian access together with associated works including provision of parking, circulation space, servicing and plant area and use of listed Riding School as a private ancillary leisure facility, associated internal and external alterations, new side extension and excavation of a lower ground floor beneath Riding School. Namely to allow changes to list of approved plans to allow increase in residential units to 171 units(increase in market housing) with associated change in unit mix, realignment of Block 4 to allow changes to The Avenue; amend Block 4 from houses to apartment building(retention of three villas on Avenue), reduction in extent and depth of basement excavation, reconfiguration of and increase in parking spaces by 14, alterations to facades and roofs of blocks 7 and 8 and alterations to landscaping plan(Application is accompanied by an Environmental Impact Assessment(EIA)); NAMELY, installation of air source heat pumps, changes of plant screen height, addition of plant screen, plant room with ventilation shaft, BMUs removed from roof level, reduction of private terrace area, redesigned stair core, addition of egress doors, new off-street entrance door, removal of basement level car stacker and minor internal layout changes, relocation of swimming pool and changing facilities.
